business.headline: Dream11, MPL, Winzo: What happens to your wallet money after Online Gaming Bill?The Online Gaming Bill, cleared by both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha this week, bans all forms of online money games. These are defined as games where players deposit money, directly or indirectly, with the hope of winning cash rewards.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro rally: Why are IT stocks rising today?Analysts said the rally reflects expectations that lower US interest rates will make emerging markets, including India, more attractive to foreign investors, supporting inflows into the sector.
Sensex rises over 200 points, Nifty above 24,900; IT stocks lead gainsAt 9:22 am, the BSE Sensex rose 203.14 points to 81,509.99, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 53.20 points to 24,923.30.

New GST rates likely by Dussehra, government braces for big revenue shortfallThe proposed GST revamp aims to simplify the tax system by introducing a two-tier rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% levy on sin goods. While the move promises greater simplicity, it is expected to significantly impact revenues for both central and state governments.

How new Income Tax Bill 2025 brings relief for salaried and small taxpayersEndless forms and confusing jargon may soon be history. The New Income Tax Bill 2025 could be the game-changer salaried and small taxpayers have been waiting for.

The hidden catch in 40-year term insurance policies and how to choose betterBuying a 40-year term insurance policy is like paying rent for a house you'll never live in that long. It feels safe, but often it's money that could be better used elsewhere.

US Fed chair signals possible September rate cut, cites rising job market risksUS Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments open the door to a rate cut at the Fed's September 16-17 meeting, but also put heavy weight on jobs and inflation reports that will be received before then.

Planning Europe trip? Schengen visa hike may upset your trip budgetThe Schengen visa allows travellers to visit 29 European countries for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. Applicants must submit standard documents, including travel plans, insurance, and financial proof.

Sebi strikes at finfluencer Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading AcademyThe action followed complaints that penny stocks were being promoted during his training sessions, allegedly presented as classroom examples while encouraging students to invest.

Which bank offers higher 1-year FD? See rates from HDFC, ICICI, SBI and 3 othersMost lenders usually announce similar interest rates on one-year deposits, making it seem as if there isn't much of a difference in where you invest. However, a closer look at the latest rates reveals small but meaningful variations.

Sensex closes 694 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Asian Paints down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 694 points lower at 81.306.85 points, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 213.65 points to end at 24,870.10.

This investor cut his Rs 10 lakh tax bill to 0. Here's howMany taxpayers assume that once the financial year ends, their chance to save tax is gone.and Ramesh was no exception. But instead of rushing, he used a little-known route that brought his tax bill down to nothing.

entertainment.headline: Aishwarya Rai nearly exited Hamara Dil Aapke Paas Hai. Anil Kapoor reveals whyAnil Kapoor celebrated 25 years of 'Hamara Dil Aapke Paas Hai' by recalling how Aishwarya Rai joined the film after initial doubts and last-minute hesitation. The 2000 Satish Kaushik-directorial became a box office hit, loved for its emotional story and the lead pair's chemistry.

K3G's young Kareena Kapoor Malvika Raaj and husband become parents to baby girlActor Malvika Raaj, known for her role as young Poo in 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham', has a new addition to her family. She and her husband, Pranav Bagga, announced the birth of their daughter via Instagram on Sunday.

Jerry Adler, Broadway stage manager and The Sopranos actor, dies at 96 in New YorkVeteran actor and stage manager Jerry Adler, best known for his roles in 'The Sopranos' and 'The Good Wife', died at the age of 96 in New York City. Starting his career on Broadway, Adler later became a beloved screen actor with memorable performances in television, film, and theatre.

Farhan Akhtar donates phones to flood-hit families in UttarakhandActor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar has reportedly donated 50 phones to flood-affected families in Uttarakhand.An NGO co-ordinated the donations between the actor and the affected families.

Nandamuri Balakrishna recognised by World Book of Records UK for 50 years in cinemaVeteran Telugu actor Nandamuri Balakrishna has been honoured by the World Book of Records UK for completing 50 years in cinema, becoming the first Telugu actor to receive this recognition. Family, fans, and leaders, including Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, celebrated his historic milestone.

Bigg Boss 19 X reactions: Gaurav Khanna, Ashnoor Kaur and Baseer Ali are top picks'Bigg Boss 19' premiered on Sunday with 16 celebrities from various fields entering the house. Amongst those, actors Gaurav Khanna and Ashnoor Kaur have emerged as fan favourites. Reality TV face Baseer Ali, singer Amaal Malik and Bhojpuri actor Neelam Puri also managed to impress the audiences.

Naagin 7 promo: Ektaa Kapoor announces new season after 18 months of waitEktaa Kapoor has announced 'Naagin 7' with a brand-new promo, 18 months after the last season. The new season will bring a fresh story, new actors, and lots of supernatural twists for fans.

Sivakarthikeyan dances to Madharasi song, Anirudh Ravichander hugs him in viral videoComposer Anirudh Ravichander made actor Sivakarthikeyan dance to 'Salambala' song at 'Madharasi' audio launch in Chennai on Sunday. The two went for a warm embrace at the event.

Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19 premiere: TV faces lose dominance in race for democracySalman Khan hosted the grand premiere of Bigg Boss 19 featuring sixteen diverse contestants and a unique democracy theme
 The episode was concise, engaging, and marked by Salman's energetic presence and fresh format

Gaurav Khanna reacts to highest-paid contestant tag on Bigg Boss 19Gaurav Khanna talks exclusively about his experience as a contestant on Bigg Boss 19. He addresses rumours about his pay and shares insights on friendships and competition in the house.

Meet women contestants from Salman's Bigg Boss 19 - Ashnoor, Nehal to Tanya, NagmaWith Salman Khan at the helm, the grand premiere of 'Bigg Boss 19' set the stage for a season packed with glamour, drama, and unexpected twists. From Ashnoor Kaur's sparkling entry to Natalia Janoszek's international charm, and from Tanya Mittal's bold questions to Nagma Mirajkar and Awez Darbar's couple entry, the mix of influencers, actors, models and entertainers promised high-voltage entertainment.

Tannishtha Chatterjee on cancer battle: It can't get worse than thisReflecting on her responsibilities, Tannishtha Chatterjee spoke about the difficulties of being a single mother while also caring for her own mother.

Who is Tanya Mittal, the Bigg Boss 19 contestant with 2.5 million Insta followers?'Bigg Boss 19' welcomes a fresh line-up of contestants, including Tanya Mittal, a social media influencer who first went viral during the Maha Kumbh and later gained attention for speaking out on the Pahalgam attack.

Tina Ahuja breaks silence on Govinda-Sunita divorce rumours, calls them baselessAmid speculation surrounding Govinda and Sunita Ahuja's marriage, their daughter Tina Ahuja has spoken out, dismissing the separation rumours as unfounded.

Shraddha Kapoor urges LinkedIn to fix her account flagged as fakeActor Shraddha Kapoor shared that she set up a LinkedIn account to document her journey as an entrepreneur, but hasn't been able to make use of it.

Bigg Boss 19 premiere: Ashnoor to Gaurav, Salman Khan welcomes 16 contestantsBigg Boss 19 Live: The wait is finally over as the much-anticipated season of Bigg Boss kicks off in just a few hours! With Salman Khan returning as host, fans can look forward to his signature wit, charm, and high-energy presence.

Mini Mathur slams paparazzi for zooming in on Kajol's body: How dare youActor Mini Mathur defended fellow actor Kajol after a video body-shaming the actor surfaced online. She slammed the paparazzo for zooming in on Kajol's body. In the comments, Mathur wrote that Kajol doesn't owe them eternal youth.

Karan Johar's 'nepo baby' Yash refuses to be launched. Priyanka, Kareena reactA recent video of filmmaker Karan Johar's son Yash in a 'nepo baby' T-shirt has stirred up social media. His son can be seen saying in the video that he does not want to be launched. Several celebrities, including Priyanka Chopra, Kareena Kapoor and Ananya Panday, amongst others, reacted to the video.

Manish Malhotra's Gustaakh Ishq with Vijay Varma and Fatima to release in NovemberFashion designer Manish Malhotra announced his first film as a producer on Sunday. Titled 'Gustaakh Ishq', the film stars Vijay Varma and Fatima Sana Shaikh in the lead roles. Slated for a November release this year, the first glimpse of the film will be out on Monday.

general news.headline: 3 defeats changed Rahul Gandhi's moral stance: Amit Shah amid criminal netas billAmit Shah drew a sharp contrast between Rahul Gandhi's past and present positions, recalling the 2013 incident when Rahul Gandhi had publicly rejected and torn an ordinance introduced by then PM Manmohan Singh's cabinet.

Trump's India tariffs 'aggressive leverage' to force Russia on Ukraine war: VanceJD Vance said President Donald Trump used "aggressive economic leverage," including secondary tariffs on India, to pressure Russia to end the Ukraine war. India defends its Russian oil imports as national interest as tensions rise in US-India trade ties.

New GST rates likely by Dussehra, government braces for big revenue shortfallThe proposed GST revamp aims to simplify the tax system by introducing a two-tier rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% levy on sin goods. While the move promises greater simplicity, it is expected to significantly impact revenues for both central and state governments.

Noida dowry death: Victim's brother-in-law, father-in-law arrestedRohit Bhati, 55, and Satyavir Bhati were arrested on charges of murder and conspiracy after the victim's elder sister, also married into the same family, filed a complaint on August 22.

Hanuman or Neil Armstrong? First space traveller answer exposes double rotBJP MP Anurag Thakur's interaction with students, where he suggested "Hanumanji was the first man in space", is problematic on multiple counts. The children said it was Neil Armstrong, and not Yuri Gagrin, who travelled to space first. The double rot is that the students were unaware of a basic fact while a parliamentarian was presenting mythology as history on National Space Day.

Man kills pregnant wife, CCTV shows him leave home with her body parts in bagsThe incident occurred due to frequent quarrels over family disputes between the 21-year-old victim, who was five-month-old pregnant, and the 27-year-old husband, who has been taken into police custody.

Rekha Gupta's attacker planned to use knife, scoped out Supreme Court: SourcesThe investigation revealed that the prime accused initially considered targeting the Supreme Court, but dropped the plan due to tight security and turned his attention to the Chief Minister's residence.

How the Supreme Court revised its stray dog judgmentIn an interim order, a three-judge bench directed only "aggressive dogs" to be held back from the streets, while coming down hard on the street-feeding of dogs.

Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19 premiere: TV faces lose dominance in race for democracySalman Khan hosted the grand premiere of Bigg Boss 19 featuring sixteen diverse contestants and a unique democracy theme
 The episode was concise, engaging, and marked by Salman's energetic presence and fresh format

Kerala Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil suspended from party amid harassment rowThe Congress suspended Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil from primary membership after harassment allegations by multiple women. He had resigned as Kerala Youth Congress president earlier. The suspension comes amid mounting protests and calls for him to quit as MLA.

Medvedev beats racket into a pulp after emotional rollercoaster vs BonziRussian star Daniil Medvedev shattered his racket after first round exit in the US Open against Benjamin Bonzi. Medvedev went through an emotional rollercoaster against his French opponent on Monday, August 25.

Dream11, MPL, Winzo: What happens to your wallet money after Online Gaming Bill?The Online Gaming Bill, cleared by both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha this week, bans all forms of online money games. These are defined as games where players deposit money, directly or indirectly, with the hope of winning cash rewards.

Pujara: Test cricket's classical violinist in the era of heavy metal bandCheteshwar Pujara retired after a career defined by grit, discipline and resilience. He was a classical violinist in an age of metal and rap. When Pujara batted, the world seemed to pause. His stillness became ours.

India will buy oil from wherever it gets best deal, says envoy to RussiaIndia has repeatedly defended its oil imports from Russia, arguing that access to affordable energy is crucial for its economic stability. Officials have also pointed out that other countries, including the US and European nations, continue some level of trade with Moscow.

Zelenskyy to visit India after PM invite, dates being finalised: Ukrainian envoyUkraine's Ambassador to India Oleksandr Polishch said Kyiv views India as a significant partner in peace negotiations because of its ties with Moscow and urged greater Indian involvement in ending the Russia-Ukraine war

First human case of flesh-eating screwworm parasite detected in US: ReportScrewworms can be devastating in cattle and wildlife, and rarely infest humans, though an infestation in either an animal or a person can be fatal.

US Open: Sinner has his own battle, not just Alcaraz threat in title defenceDefending US Open champion Jannik Sinner faces a two-front battle in New York — fitness concerns and the relentless Carlos Alcaraz. With their rivalry heating up, Sinner's title defence could hinge on his recovery as much as his tennis.

After 13 years, Pak Foreign Minister in Dhaka as Yunus presses for Saarc revivalDuring his meeting with Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar on Sunday, Yunus once again stressed the need to strengthen not only bilateral ties but also regional cooperation with Islamabad. At the heart of his push for stronger regional engagement is Yunus's renewed drive to get Saarc up and running.

Delhi Metro ticket prices hiked after 8 years. Check revised faresThe increase, effective August 25, 2025, ranges from Rs 1 to Rs 4 depending on the distance of travel, and up to Rs 5 on the Airport Express Line.
Why the Kishtwar tragedy is a wake-up callThe recent flash flood in J&K is an urgent reminder of the need to address the impacts of climate change on fragile ecosystems in the mountains.

Video: Man kisses Rahul Gandhi on bike during Bihar rally; gets slapped by guardThe incident took place as the Lok Sabha Opposition leader, along with RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, was leading a motorcycle rally as part of the yatra.

Indian restaurant in London set on fire in arson attack, 5 diners injuredA teenager and a man were arrested after a fire tore through an east London Indian restaurant, injuring five. CCTV suggests arson, with two victims still in life-threatening condition.

PM Modi's Gujarat visit from today, to launch projects worth Rs 5,400 croreThe visit will commence with a 3-km roadshow from Naroda to Nikol in Ahmedabad after PM Modi's arrival at the city airport in the evening.

Caught on camera: YouTuber swept away while filming reels at waterfall in OdishaSagar Tudu, a YouTuber, was filming videos for his channel at Dduma Waterfall in Koraput when he was swept away by a strong current.

Aishwarya Rai nearly exited Hamara Dil Aapke Paas Hai. Anil Kapoor reveals whyAnil Kapoor celebrated 25 years of 'Hamara Dil Aapke Paas Hai' by recalling how Aishwarya Rai joined the film after initial doubts and last-minute hesitation. The 2000 Satish Kaushik-directorial became a box office hit, loved for its emotional story and the lead pair's chemistry.

K3G's young Kareena Kapoor Malvika Raaj and husband become parents to baby girlActor Malvika Raaj, known for her role as young Poo in 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham', has a new addition to her family. She and her husband, Pranav Bagga, announced the birth of their daughter via Instagram on Sunday.

Jerry Adler, Broadway stage manager and The Sopranos actor, dies at 96 in New YorkVeteran actor and stage manager Jerry Adler, best known for his roles in 'The Sopranos' and 'The Good Wife', died at the age of 96 in New York City. Starting his career on Broadway, Adler later became a beloved screen actor with memorable performances in television, film, and theatre.

Farhan Akhtar donates phones to flood-hit families in UttarakhandActor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar has reportedly donated 50 phones to flood-affected families in Uttarakhand.An NGO co-ordinated the donations between the actor and the affected families.

sports.headline: Sanju Samson warms up for Asia Cup with blazing 42-ball century as openerIndia batter Sanju Samson slammed a breathtaking 42-ball century in Match 8 of the Kerala Cricket League. Samson played a breathtaking innings of 121 (51) to help Kochi Blue Tigers chase down 237.

Nottingham Forest boss Nuno Espirito Santo dismisses exit speculation as absurdNottingham Forest manager Nuno Espirito Santo has dismissed speculation over his future, calling rumours that he could walk away from the club "absurd" after Sunday's 1-1 draw at Crystal Palace.

Kylian Mbappe scores twice as Real Madrid down newly promoted OviedoKylian Mbappe scored a brace as Real Madrid maintained their winning run in LaLiga on Sunday. The runner-ups last season beat newly promoted Real Oviedo by 3 goals.

Serena welcomes former rival, forever friend Sharapova into tennis Hall of FameA touching moment unfolded between former rivals Serena Williams and Maria Sharapova at Saturday's International Tennis Hall of Fame induction ceremony in Newport, as Williams took the stage to introduce Sharapova and paid tribute to her with a heartfelt speech.

Amorim blames Manchester United's defensive mindset for draw vs FulhamManchester United manager Ruben Amorim lamented that his players abandoned their attacking principles after taking the lead against Fulham, arguing that a defensive mentality proved costly in Sunday's 1-1 Premier League draw at Craven Cottage.

Djokovic overcomes pain to reach US Open 2nd round: Wish I was youngerNovak Djokovic said he wished he was younger after delivering a masterclass in Grand Slam tenacity to American teenager Learner Tien, battling past him 6-1, 7-6(3), 6-2 in the US Open first round on Sunday to launch his latest quest for a record 25th major title.

Carlos Alcaraz eyes New York glory to end three-year agonising waitCarlos Alcaraz, already a five-time Grand Slam champion, is still chasing consistency on hard courts, with his 2022 US Open triumph remaining his lone major success on the surface. Armed with momentum from a strong 2025 season, he now returns to New York determined to end his drought and reclaim hard-court glory.

Pujara: Test cricket's classical violinist in the era of heavy metal bandCheteshwar Pujara retired after a career defined by grit, discipline and resilience. He was a classical violinist in an age of metal and rap. When Pujara batted, the world seemed to pause. His stillness became ours.

US Open: Sinner has his own battle, not just Alcaraz threat in title defenceDefending US Open champion Jannik Sinner faces a two-front battle in New York — fitness concerns and the relentless Carlos Alcaraz. With their rivalry heating up, Sinner's title defence could hinge on his recovery as much as his tennis.

US Open: Emma Raducanu ends Flushing Meadows jinx, secures first win since 2021Former US Open champion Emma Raducanu ended her Flushing Meadows drought with a 6-1, 6-2 win over Ena Shibahara in the first round. The 22-year-old Briton clinched her first US Open victory since her 2021 title run.

Rohit Yadav keeps World Championship hopes alive, Sreeshankar misses qualifying markRohit Yadav clinched gold in men's javelin with an 83.65m throw at the National Inter-State Athletics Championships, while Murali Sreeshankar fell short of World Championships qualifying mark despite winning long jump title.

Armed with momentum from a strong 2025 season, he now returns to New York determined to end his drought and reclaim hard-court glory.

With their rivalry heating up, Sinner's title defence could hinge on his recovery as much as his tennis.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
